name: Probability Space
description: A probability space is a formal model that describes what an "experiment" with "events" is. In broad terms, it is the combination of a sample space $\Omega$, a sigma algebra $\sigma$, and a probability function $\mathbb{P}$. We denote a probability space with the tuple $(\Omega, \sigma, \mathbb{P})$ though we will often omit the sigma algebra for undergraduate probability theory.
